Key Match Events: Edwin Diaz blew a save in the eighth inning, allowing a game-winning grand slam to Corbin Carroll.
Corbin Carroll hit a go-ahead grand slam on a slider in the eighth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Edwin Diaz expressed frustration about not getting the job done in the save situation.
Luis Severino was hurt by a line drive but stayed in the game, allowing four earned runs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets fell into a 4-0 hole after four innings before rallying to tie the game in the fifth.
Starling Marte's legwork was key in the Mets scoring the go-ahead run in the sixth inning.
Luis Guillorme played against his former team and delivered a crucial RBI single in the second inning.
Others: The Diamondbacks' bullpen performed well after the early runs, preventing the Mets from tying the game again.
Lourdes Gurriel Jr. walked leading off the inning against Phil Maton, starting the rally for the Mets.
